intro: Hypecoum procumbens var. glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-flowered candytuft, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It features compact, rounded foliage and produces clusters of small, sky-blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has a fibrous root system and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its flowers are typically 5-lobed and have a delicate, almost translucent appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
